commercial emporium of the South and of the broad West,
the obstructions to her commerce at the mouths of the river
must be removed at once. As dredging machinery has failed
under the most favorable auspices, and as the principle of
concentration by piling has proved itself impracticable, my
decided opinon is that the simplest plan is the best; and
that the most intelligent, practical, common-sense method—
one that has more natural reasons and scientific facts to back
and favor it, is the ordinary heavy dredge harrow and scraper.","fullrs":{},"find":"2432.jp2","dmaccess":{},"dmimage":{},"dmcreated":"2012-01-18","dmmodified":"2012-01-18","dmoclcno":{},"dmrecord":"2431","restrictionCode":"1","cdmfilesize":"480597","cdmfilesizeformatted":"0.46 MB","cdmprintpdf":"0","cdmhasocr":"1","cdmisnewspaper":"0"}
